is a large town in south

Patchway was first constructed in the 1950s, after the post world war II baby boom resulted in more houses from bristol to be buiilt in overspill estates. It has since developed a distinct identiy of its own, and is still under expansion today with its new Charlton Hayes development.

It is a place for shopping and working too, with major employers including Rolls Royce, the Aztec West industrial park and the Cribbs Causeway regional shopping centre.

By road, the A38 or M5 Junction 16 or 17. Access to cribbs causeway has been changed since the new Charlton Hayes development, so shoppers are advised to take Junction 17 while people wanting to see Aztec West use junction 16.
The Area is well served with Bus Services, with a small bus terminal located at the Cribbs Causeway shopping centre
The Aztec West nature reserve, where there are many large ponds to see local nature and wild life. There is also Norman Scott Park and Patchway BMX track located on the other side of Aztec West.
There is the Venue at Cribbs Causeway, which includes a Cinema, Bowling alley and many American style restaurants

value: The Centre of The Mall at Cribbs Causeway

The Cribbs Causeway shopping mall is a very large shopping centre, catering to most shopping needs. There is also an ASDA and Morrisons supermarket. For wholesalers there is a Makro store which supplys many of the smaller shops in the area with a large range of products
There is a variety of fast food restaurants
There is the preview bar and grill, plus the Patchway Labour Club.
There is the Aztec West Hotel
There is internet access available at the Cribbs Causeway Apple Store.
